IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE MISSION OF THE COLLEGE OF SAINT BENEDICT IS TO PROVIDE FOR WOMEN THE BEST RESIDENTIAL LIBERAL ARTS EDUCATION IN THE CATHOLIC BENEDICTINE TRADITIONS. THE COLLEGE FOSTERS INTEGRATED LEARNING, EXCEPTIONAL LEADERSHIP FOR CHANGE AND WISDOM FOR A LIFETIME.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE MISSION OF THE COLLEGE OF SAINT BENEDICT IS TO PROVIDE FOR WOMEN THE BEST RESIDENTIAL LIBERAL ARTS EDUCATION IN THE CATHOLIC BENEDICTINE TRADITIONS. THE COLLEGE FOSTERS INTEGRATED LEARNING, EXCEPTIONAL LEADERSHIP FOR CHANGE AND WISDOM FOR A LIFETIME.
IRS990.Desc: HIGHER EDUCATION: EDUCATIONAL INSTRUCTION, 932 FALL FTE STUDENTS ENROLLED IN UNDERGRADUATE COURSES, 423 GRADUATES. THE COLLEGE OF SAINT BENEDICT WILL BE NATIONALLY RECOGNIZED AS A COMMUNITY THAT PROVIDES A LIBERAL ARTS EDUCATION PREPARING WOMEN TO THINK CRITICALLY, LEAD COURAGEOUSLY, AND ADVOCATE PASSIONATELY. THE COLLEGE OF SAINT BENEDICT DESIGNS PROGRAMS TO MEET THE NEEDS AND ASPIRATIONS OF YOUNG WOMEN, EMPHASIZING WOMEN'S LEADERSHIP AND A PERSONAL DEVELOPMENT PROFILE THAT INCLUDES INTELLECTUAL, SPIRITUAL, EMOTIONAL AND PHYSICAL DEVELOPMENT. ITS VALUES-BASED AND VALUE-ADDED RESIDENTIAL LIBERAL ARTS EDUCATION PROVIDES THE FRAMEWORK FOR FULFILLING LIVES OF DISCIPLINED INQUIRY AND LEADERSHIP IN CAREERS DEVOTED TO THE PROFESSIONS, PUBLIC LIFE AND SERVICE TO OTHERS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: HIGHER EDUCATION: AUXILIARY REVENUE (DINING, HOUSING, ETC.) 1,932 STUDENTS. THE RESIDENTIAL LIFE PROGRAM AT THE COLLEGE OF SAINT BENEDICT PROVIDES A FOUR YEAR RESIDENTIAL EXPERIENCE OF COMMUNITY LIVING WHICH SUPPORTS AND CHALLENGES OUR STUDENTS WITH OPPORTUNITIES FOR PERSONAL AND SOCIAL GROWTH. THIS EXPERIENCE ALLOWS WOMEN TO DEVELOP AN UNDERSTANDING AND APPRECIATION OF THEIR RESPONSIBILITIES TO THEMSELVES AND OTHERS LIVING IN THE COMMUNITY ON CAMPUS AND BEYOND.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES. FINE ARTS PROGRAMMING AND OTHER STUDENT AND COMMUNITY SERVICES DESIGNED TO FOSTER DEVELOPMENT AND GROWTH OUTSIDE THE CLASSROOM. OUR FINE ARTS EVENTS BRING THE FINEST REGIONAL AND NATIONAL ARTISTS TO OUR COMMUNITY. OTHER PROGRAMS INCLUDING SERVICE TRIPS, CONFERENCES, AND CAMPUS EVENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: SCHEDULE C, PART II-B, LINE 1 - COLLEGE OF SAINT BENEDICT IS A MEMBER OF MINNESOTA PRIVATE COLLEGE COUNCIL (MPCC), AN ORGANIZATION DESCRIBED IN SECTION 501(C)(4) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. MPCC IS AN ASSOCIATION OF PRIVATE NONPROFIT INSTITUTIONS OF HIGHER EDUCATION THAT SERVES A VARIETY OF ITS MEMBERS' SHARED NEEDS, INCLUDING, BUT NOT ONLY, NONPARTISAN AND NON-ELECTORAL ADVOCACY FOR PUBLIC POLICY THAT MEETS STUDENTS' NEEDS AND ADVANCES THE INTERESTS OF PRIVATE HIGHER EDUCATION. COLLEGE OF SAINT BENEDICT PAID MEMBERSHIP DUES TO MPCC IN THE AMOUNT OF $136,233 DURING THE TAXABLE YEAR. MPCC HAS DIVIDED ITS EXPENSES FOR ITS TAXABLE YEAR ENDING JUNE 30, 2016 INTO TWO GROUPS. GROUP 1 CONSISTS OF THOSE EXPENSES THAT DID NOT IN ANY WAY SUPPORT ATTEMPTS TO INFLUENCE LEGISLATION WITHIN THE MEANING OF SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE ("LOBBYING"), AND GROUP 2 CONSISTS OF ALL OTHER EXPENSES. GROUP 2 INCLUDES MANY EXPENSES BETWEEN LOBBYING AND NONLOBBYING ACTIVITIES. MPCC HAS DETERMINED THAT THE AMOUNT OF THE GROUP 2 EXPENSES REPRESENTS 72.9% OF THE AMOUNT OF THE DUES THAT MPCC COLLECTED IN THE SAME TAXABLE YEAR. ASSUMING THAT ALL GROUP 2 EXPENSES WERE PAID FROM MEMBER DUES, AND ALLOCATING THOSE EXPENSES PRO RATA BASED ON THE DUES PAID BY EACH MEMBER, $99,314 OF COLLEGE OF SAINT BENEDICT'S DUES WERE USED TO PAY GROUP 2 EXPENSES. THE AMOUNT OF LOBBYING EXPENSES PAID FROM COLLEGE OF SAINT BENEDICT'S DUES WAS SIGNIFICANTLY LESS THAN THAT AMOUNT.
ENDOWMENT DRAW IS USED TO FUND STUDENT SCHOLARSHIPS AND ACADEMIC PROGRAMS.

THE COLLEGE FOLLOWS THE ACCOUNTING STANDARDS FOR CONTINGENCIES IN EVALUATING UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS. THIS GUIDANCE PRESCRIBES RECOGNITION THRESHOLD PRINCIPLES FOR THE FINANCIAL STATEMENT RECOGNITION OF TAX POSITIONS TAKEN OR EXPECTED TO BE TAKEN ON A TAX RETURN THAT ARE NOT CERTAIN TO BE REALIZED. NO LIABILITY HAS BEEN RECOGNIZED BY THE COLLEGE FOR UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS AS OF JUNE 30, 2016 AND 2015. THE COLLEGE'S TAX RETURNS ARE SUBJECT TO REVIEW AND EXAMINATION BY FEDERAL AND STATE AUTHORITIES.
DIRECT FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 9,704. STUDENT FINANCIAL AID -40,079,917. ADJUSTMENT OF ACTUARIAL LIABILITY -74,223.
DIRECT FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 9,704. STUDENT FINANCIAL AID -40,079,917.
COLLEGE OF SAINT BENEDICT INCLUDES RACIALLY NONDISCRIMINATORY POLICIES IN NEWSPAPER PUBLICATIONS FOR JOB SEARCHES AND PUBLICATIONS THAT GO OUT TO CURRENT AND POTENTIAL STUDENTS.
COLLEGE OF SAINT BENEDICT RECEIVES FINANCIAL AID FOR STUDENTS.

DOCUMENTATION IS MAINTAINED WHICH SUBSTANTIATES ELIGIBILITY AND THE AMOUNT OF ASSISTANCE GIVEN TO STUDENTS. NEED BASED ELIGIBILITY FOR SCHOLARSHIPS IS DETERMINED USING INFORMATION ON THE FAFSA. MERIT BASED STUDENT AID IS DETERMINED USING VARIOUS FACTORS TO ASSESS ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE OF THE STUDENT.
THE COLLEGE HELD AN OWNERSHIP INTEREST IN A FOREIGN CORPORATION DURING THE TAX YEAR. HOWEVER, THE COLLEGE DOES NOT MEET THE FILING REQUIREMENT OF FORM 5471 AS A RESULT.

DOCUMENTATION IS MAINTAINED WHICH SUBSTANTIATES ELIGIBILITY AND THE AMOUNT OF ASSISTANCE GIVEN TO STUDENTS. NEED BASED ELIGIBILITY FOR SCHOLARSHIPS IS DETERMINED USING INFORMATION ON THE FAFSA. MERIT BASED STUDENT AID IS DETERMINED USING VARIOUS FACTORS TO ASSESS ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE OF THE STUDENT.
AS A REQUIREMENT OF THEIR CONTRACTS, HOUSING IS PROVIDED TO THE PRESIDENT, VP ENROLLMENT, AND VP INSTITUTIONAL ADVANCEMENT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE J, PART II, COLUMN D:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COLUMN D INCLUDES TUITION REMISSION BENEFITS FOR ONE OR MORE FAMILY MEMBERS OF CALVIN RYAN-MOSLEY, BRAD SINN, AND ANNE OBERMAN.

REFINANCE 2 PRIOR BONDS AND FUND ADD'L PROJECT
REFINANCE 5W BONDS, ORIGINALLY FOR VAR. STUDENT HOUSING REMODELING PROJECTS
FINANCE RENOVATION PROJECTS AND ATHLETIC FIELDS

GrntAsstBnftInterestedPrsnGrp.RelationshipWithOrgTxt: FAMILY MEMBERS OF OFFICERS, TRUSTEES, AND KEY EMPLOYEES

SecuritiesPubliclyTradedGrp.MethodOfDeterminingRevenuesTxt: AVG HIGH AND LOW FOR DAY

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE NUMBER IN COLUMN (B) REPRESENTS THE TOTAL NUMBER OF CONTRIBUTIONS OF THIS TYPE, IT DOES NOT REPRESENT THE NUMBER OF STOCK SHARES RECEIVED.

STOCK BROKERS PROCESS STOCK TRANSACTIONS WHEN THE GIFT IS RECEIVED AND THE COLLEGE CHOOSES TO LIQUIDATE THE STOCK. REAL ESTATE BROKERS, APPRAISERS, AND ATTORNEYS ARE CONSULTED WHEN GIFTS OF PROPERTY ARE RECEIVED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE MEMBERS OF THE CORPORATION SHALL CONSIST OF THE OFFICERS OF THE SISTERS OF THE ORDER OF SAINT BENEDICT AND ARE REFERRED TO AS THE CORPORATE MEMBERS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AS STATED IN THE ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION, THE CORPORATE MEMBERS RETAIN THE FOLLOWING RESERVED POWERS 1) APPOINT THOSE PERSONS WHO SERVE AS VOTING MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AS STATED IN THE ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION, THE CORPORATE MEMBERS RETAIN THE FOLLOWING RESERVED POWERS 1) APPOINT THOSE PERSONS WHO SERVE AS VOTING MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES; 2) APPROVE ANY MERGER, ACQUISITION, OR DISSOLUTION OF THE CORPORATION; 3) APPROVE THE SALE OR ENCUMBRANCE OF ALL OR SUBSTANTIALLY ALL OF THE ASSETS OF THE CORPORATION; 4) AMEND THE ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION, OR 5) MAKE AND AMEND THE BYLAWS OF THE CORPORATION. THE CORPORATE MEMBERS ARE THE SISTERS OF THE ORDER OF ST. BENEDICT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SUBCOMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES KNOWN AS THE AUDIT COMMITTEE REVIEWS THE 990 DURING THE SPRING MEETING PRIOR TO FILING THE FORM AND THE FORM IS MADE AVAILABLE FOR REVIEW BY ALL BOARD MEMBERS PRIOR TO FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE AUDIT COMMITTEE REVIEWS ALL DISCLOSURES ON THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ANNUALLY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE EMPLOYEE HANDBOOK, THE COMPENSATION PLAN IS DESIGNED TO ENSURE POSITIONS ARE COMPETITIVELY VALUED RELATIVE TO COMPARABLE JOBS IN THE MARKET. THE HUMAN RESOURCES DEPARTMENT DOES A COMPARISON OF JOB DESCRIPTIONS TO POSITION DESCRIPTIONS IN THE MARKETPLACE ANNUALLY. THE COMPARISON FOR ADMINISTRATIVE AND SUPPORT STAFF POSITIONS ARE APPROVED BY THE PRESIDENT OR BOARD OF TRUSTEES AND A SALARY RANGE IS CREATED BASED ON THIS COMPARISON. FACULTY SALARIES ARE COMPARED TO A MARKET BASKET OF SIMILAR INSTITUTIONS. SALARIES FOR THE PRESIDENT, THE PROVOST, AND THE VICE PRESIDENT FOR FINANCE AND ADMINISTRATION ARE REVIEWED AND DETERMINED BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. THE POSITIONS ARE COMPARED TO SIMILAR INSTITUTIONS OF HIGHER EDUCATION WITH RESPECT TO ENROLLMENT, BUDGET, AND CARNEGIE CLASSIFICATION FOUND IN THE COLLEGE AND UNIVERSITY PERSONNEL ASSOCIATION SALARY SURVEY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ARE NOT AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC, BUT WOULD BE MADE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST. THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE ON THE WEBSITE.
ADJUSTMENT OF ACTUARIAL LIABILITY -74,223.
